alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 5:25PM EDT until July 07 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN RUTLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN WINDSOR COUNTIES... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in portions of the warning area. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible over the next hour. Flash flooding is likely ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, secondary roads, as well as other poor drainage and low- lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chester, Andover, Weston, Ludlow, Mount Holly, Mount Tabor and Simonsville. This includes portions of the West River and its tributaries near and just above Weston, Vermont. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
